urlText: Bus diversions for music festival
content:
Route 339, 373, 333, 340, and 352 buses through Randwick will use alternative stops due to the closure of Oxford St and the bus roadway for a music festival at Centennial Parklands on Sunday, 6 October.
 
From 9pm to 11pm, buses will use stops on Anzac Pde and Alison Rd.
 
Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations. For more information on the event, see the Listen Out event page.
 
Closed Bus Stops
 
Oxford Street
  • St Matthias Anglican Church, Oxford St (Stop ID 202150)
    • Alternative stop: Paddington School, Oxford St (Stop ID 202151)
Moore Park Busway
  • Moore Park Busway at Lang Rd (Stop ID 202144)
    • Alternative stop: Anzac Pde opposite Centennial Parklands Sports Centre (Stop ID TSN202112)
  • Moore Park Busway after Lang Rd (Stop ID TSN202143)
    • Alternative stop: Centennial Parklands Sports Centre, Anzac Pde (Stop ID TSN202128)
  • Moore Park Busway at Robertson Rd (Stop ID TSN202138)
    • Alternative stop: Anzac Pde opposite Robertson Rd (Stop ID TSN202111)
  • Moore Park Busway at Robertson Rd (Stop ID TSN212145)
    • Alternative stop: Anzac Pde before Robertson Rd (Stop ID TSN202129)
  • Moore Park Busway after Alison Rd (Stop ID TSN203348)
    • Alternative stop: Alison Rd before Doncaster Ave (Stop ID TSN203143)
  • Moore Park Busway before Alison Rd (Stop ID TSN202146)
    • Alternative stop: Alison Rd opposite Doncaster Ave (Stop ID TSN203337)

urlText: City Circle: Trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay
content:
Tuesday 8 to Thursday 10 October
  • Nightly from 10pm to 1.30am, trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay.
  • T1 North Shore & Western, T2 Inner West and T9 Northern Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall and Wynyard.
  • T4 Eastern Suburbs Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall, Martin Place and Kings Cross.
  • The light rail runs in both directions between Circular Quay and Central.
  • If you are travelling to:
    • Circular Quay, change at Wynyard for the light rail or walk
    • Museum or St James, change at Central or Town Hall for local buses or walk
  • Other lines are also affected by this work. Please check details before you travel.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: Redfern diversions due to Police Operation
content:
Saturday 5 October
  • From 7.30am to 12.30pm, route 352 buses will divert around a section of Cleveland St due to road closures in place for a planned Police Operation.
  • Buses towards Marrickville will divert via Elizabeth St, Raglan St, Henderson St, Wyndham St, Gibbons St, Regent St then rejoin Cleveland St.
  • Buses towards Bondi Junction will divert via Regent St, Redfern St, Chalmers St then rejoin Cleveland St.
  • Stops on Cleveland St between Regent St and Chalmers St will be missed in both directions. Check signs at stops and allow extra travel time.
subtitle: Redfern diversions due to Police Operation

urlText: Buses replace trains between Hornsby and Rhodes
content:
Monday 30 September and Thursday 3 October
  • Nightly from 9.40pm to 2am, buses replace trains between Hornsby and Rhodes.
  • Trains run between Rhodes and the City, to a changed timetable.
  • Metro services run between Epping and the City.
  • Most Central Coast & Newcastle Line trains run to a changed timetable via the T1 North Shore Line, making extra stops at Gordon, Chatswood, then all stations to Central.

  • Replacement buses for trackwork may be affected by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
83T9 Rhodes, then express to Epping, then all stations to Hornsby and return
84T9 Rhodes, then all stations to Epping (except Denistone) and return
85T9 West Ryde, Denistone, Eastwood and return
92T9 Central, then express to Hornsby (limited service Tuesday to Friday in that direction only)
subtitle: Buses replace trains between Hornsby and Rhodes

urlText: Trains run via the T1 North Shore Line. Buses replace some trains
content:
Monday 30 September to Thursday 3 October
  • Nightly from 10pm to 3am, trains run to a changed timetable via the T1 North Shore Line, making extra stops at Gordon, Chatswood, then all stations to Central.
  • Trackwork also affects trains on the T9 Northern Line.
  • Buses run between Strathfield and Hornsby to connect with Central Coast & Newcastle Line trains.
  • Trains towards Newcastle Interchange run up to 30 minutes later than the normal timetable.

  • Tuesday to Friday, buses replace the 01:47 Central to Newcastle Interchange service from Central to Hornsby.

  • Wednesday, buses also replace the 00:47 Central to Newcastle Interchange service from Central to Hornsby.

  • Replacement buses for trackwork may be affected by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
90T9 Strathfield, Epping, then express to Hornsby and return
92T9 Central, then express to Hornsby (limited service Tuesday to Friday in that direction only)
subtitle: Trains run via the T1 North Shore Line. Buses replace some trains

content:

Buses to the city will end trips at Town Hall House, Druitt St Stand N and start trips from Druitt St, Stand L.
 
Some stops will be missed while roads are closed. Check signs at stops and allow extra time.

  • William St Opp Australian Museum (201154)
  • Riley St Opp Kennedy St (201157)

urlText: Eastwood bus diversions for Festival event
content:
From 5pm Friday to 11pm Saturday, buses will be diverting around a section of West Pde and missing stops due to road closures for the Granny Smith Festival.
 
Services travelling to Eastwood will divert via First Ave, Blaxland Rd and Ethel St to end their trips at Eastwood Station Stand E on Ethel St (Stop ID 212213).
 
Services travelling to Ryde will start their trips at Eastwood Station Stand D on Railway Pde (Stop ID 212212).
 
Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time.
 
Missed stop
  • Eastwood Station, West Pde, Stand A Eastwood (Stop ID 212214)

urlText: Eastwood bus diversions for Festival event
content:
From 5pm Friday to 11pm Saturday, buses will be diverting around a section of West Pde, Hillview Rd as well as Terry Rd, and missing stops due to road closures for the Granny Smith Festival.
 
Services travelling to Parramatta will be diverting via Rutledge St, Wentworth Rd, Rowe St and Darvall Rd. 
 
Services travelling to Macquarie Park will be diverting via Darvall Rd and Rutledge St.
 
Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time.
 
Missed and Alternative Stops
  • Eastwood Station, West Pde, Stand A Eastwood (Stop ID 212214)
    • Alternative stop to Parramatta: Eastwood Station, Railway Pde, Stand D Eastwood (Stop ID 212212)
  • Marist College, Hillview Rd Eastwood (Stop ID 2122123)
    • Alternative stop to Parramatta: Eastwood Station, Railway Pde, Stand D Eastwood (Stop ID 212212)
  • Terry Rd at Shaftsbury Rd Eastwood (Stop ID 2122124)

Sydney Olympic Park Major Event Buses will run for the NRL & NRLW Grand Final on Sunday 6 October 2024 at Accor Stadium.
 
Travel on the Major Event Buses is included in the cost of your event ticket. Attendees do not need to tap on and off, simply show your match ticket to the driver when boarding buses.
 
Buses run every 5 to 20 minutes, subject to traffic conditions.
 
For more information visit the NRL & NRLW Grand Final event page.

urlText: Sydney Olympic Park bus diversions for NRL & NRLW Grand Final
content:
From 1.30am Sunday 6 October until 3am Monday 7 October, route 525 and 526 services will be diverting while roads are closed in Sydney Olympic Park for the NRL & NRLW Grand Final on Sunday 6 October.
 
Services in both directions will be diverting via Edwin Flack Ave, Sarah Durack Ave and Australia Ave, and will miss stops on Dawn Fraser Ave and Park St. Catch these services from the stop on Park St at Olympic Park train station or other alternative stop locations on Edwin Flack Ave.
 
Allow extra time and check signs at stops for alternate stop locations. Visit the NRL & NRLW Grand Final event page for more details.
 
Closed stops
  • Park Street opposite Olympic Park Station (212790)
    • Alternate stop: Olympic Park Station, Park Street (212712)
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue opposite Olympic Park Station (212791)
    • Alternate stop: Olympic Park Station, Park Street (212712)

  • Dawn Fraser Avenue after Edwin Flack Avenue (212787)

    • Alternate stop for route 525 only: Accor Stadium, Edwin Flack Avenue (212736)
  • Olympic Park Station, Dawn Fraser Avenue (212792)

• 8pm Friday 3 November to 5am Monday 6 November 2023
  • 8pm Friday 10 November to 5am Monday 13 November 2023
  • 8pm Friday 17 November to 5am Monday 20 November 2023
  • 8pm Friday 24 November to 5am Monday 27 November 2023
  • 8pm Friday 1 December to 5am Monday 4 December 2023
  • 8pm Friday 8 December to 5am Monday 11 December 2023
  • 8pm Friday 15 December to 5am Monday 18 December 2023

urlText: Greenwich Point Wharf closed
content:
Monday 22 April until late 2024
 
Greenwich Point Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:
  • Use the existing 265 bus route which travels from Lane Cove to North Sydney via Greenwich, connecting with St Leonards and North Sydney train stations.
  • Additional bus services for the 265 route will be provided between Greenwich Point Wharf and Crows Nest, via St Leonards during weekdays and nights and over the weekends to offset the missing ferry services.
  • Captain Cook Cruises operates a commuter ferry service during peak travel times from Greenwich Wharf Bay Street. Please check their website for more information.
  • Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements and check information displays for service updates.
  • For more information on the Greenwich Point Wharf Upgrade please visit the Greenwich Point Wharf Upgrade page.
subtitle: Greenwich Point Wharf closed

properties.smsText: Greenwich Point Wharf closed
properties.speechText:
From 22 April until late 2024, Greenwich Point Wharf will close temporarily for upgrades.
Ferries will not stop at Greenwich Point Wharf during the closure.
Use bus route 265 to St Leonards and North Sydney Train stations from Lower Serpentine Road.

urlText: L2 and L3 light rail services may be temporarily held at stops or partially closed due to a Police Operation
content:
L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line light rail services may be impacted between 2pm and 3pm approximately due to road closures around Town Hall for a planned Police Operation protest march:
  • L2 and L3 services may be temporarily held at stops, or
  • L2 and L3 services may be temporarily partially closed between Town Hall and Circular Quay or Central Chalmers Street.
Impact to services and timings may change at the direction of NSW Police.
 
Please check information screens at stops, listen to announcements and follow the direction of staff or Police on site, as necessary.
 
Allow extra travel time and use the Trip Planner for alternative transport options, including trains, buses or walking.
 
L1 Dulwich Hill Line light rail services should continue to run as per normal.

urlText: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades
content:
Monday 3 June until late 2024

South Mosman Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:

  • Public transport options include F2 and F6 ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf.
  • Use the existing 111 bus service from Musgrave Street to Canrobert Street and change to the 230 bus from Avenue Road to Mosman Bay Wharf.
  • The 230 bus service from Military Road can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
  • Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements, and check information displays for service updates.
subtitle: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades

properties.smsText: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades
properties.speechText:
From Monday 3rd June until late 2024, South Mosman Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:

Public transport options include F 2 and F 6 ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf.
Use the existing 1 1 1 bus service from Musgrave Street to Canrobert Street and change to the 230 bus from Avenue Road to Mosman Bay Wharf.
The 2 3 0 bus service from Military Road can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements, and check information displays for service updates.

urlText: Station Update - Town Hall
content:
From Monday 12 August to mid-October 2024, one of the escalators servicing the concourse to platforms 5 and 6 will be closed to undergo maintenance work to improve safety and reliability. 
You will be able to use the other escalator, lift or the stairs through platform 3 to access platforms 5 and 6. Please allow for additional travel time to enter or exit platforms 5 and 6. 
If you need assistance, ask station staff or call 9379 4121.
subtitle: Station Update - Town Hall

urlText: Some trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern
content:
Saturday 5 October
  • From 6.30am to 10.30am, trains run between Liverpool and Lidcombe, and between Ashfield and the City, some to a changed timetable. You may need to change trains to continue your journey.
  • T2 trains make extra stops at Homebush and Croydon.
  • Some T1 trains make extra stops at Homebush and Burwood, and some T9 trains make extra stops at Croydon and Ashfield.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions due to Police Operation
content:
Route 100 buses will be diverting from 1.45pm to 2.45pm due to road closures in place for a planned Police Operation protest march.
 
Buses to the city will divert via Market St. Services will run from Clarence St at Council Pl (2000139).
 
Buses will miss the stop QVB, York St, Stand D (200044) in both directions. Continue on foot.
 
Check signs at stops and allow extra time.
 
Missed stops:
  • QVB, York St, Stand D Sydney (200044)
subtitle: Sydney CBD diversions due to Police Operation
